newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - 3Com cut to neutral.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - 3Com cut to neutral.

text.p: - Gruntal & Co Inc said Thursday it downgraded its rating on 3Com Corp to neutral from long-term outperform, based on the added risk of the proposed merger of it and modem maker U.S. Robotics Corp.
"While the combined company has unbeatable strengths in the access market and in retail channels, we also see near-term risks outweighing near-term gains," analyst David Takata said in a statement.

- U.S. Robotics is in a transition to its "x2" 56-kilobit per second modem technology, as are others in the computer modem industry. As there is still no compatibility standard for the high-speed technolgoy, Gruntal said it creates a "winner take all" situation.
"While investors are 'braced' for a poor U.S. Robotics quarter, we are concerned that 3Com is adopting a U.S. Robotics product transition risk of considerable magnitude," Takata said.
- Gruntal said it is maintaining its 1998 earnings estimates, except for the expectation of a "large" one-time charge related to the merger, either in its fiscal first or fourth quarter.
- Long term, Gruntal said it expects a strong combined company in the access markets and reseller channels, and expects it to benefit from low-cost manufacturing.
